fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Jira Development Panel (specifically the Deployments section) fails to render deployment information for standard users when the corresponding Bamboo API response contains a deployment project with an {*}empty {{environments}} array{*}. This occurs because the JavaScript logic on the Jira frontend attempts to calculate the latest deployment date without checking for an empty array, leading to a {{{}TypeError{}}}.

This behavior was introduced/exposed after upgrading the Jira host environment to *Java 17* (affecting Jira versions 9.12.16 and 10.3.11).
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Jira instance (9.12.16 or 10.3.11, running on Java 17) to link with a Bamboo instance.
# In Bamboo, create a deployment project (e.g., "Test-deploy") with one or more environments.
# Ensure a standard, non-admin user *does not have permission* to view _any_ of the environments in that deployment project.
# Navigate to a Jira issue that is linked to this deployment project.
# Observe the Deployments panel in Jira as the standard user.

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Development Panel should *gracefully handle* the deployment project. The project name should be visible, and the deployment details section for that project should indicate "No deployments" or render with a valid status, as the Bamboo API is returning a successful response with filtered data. The issue page should load completely without JavaScript errors.

h3. Actual Results
The deployments section for the issue *fails to render* for the standard user. This is often followed by the entire deployment information being hidden or corrupted on the page.

The following JavaScript error is thrown in the browser console:
{noformat}
TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'e.last(e.sortBy(t.environments,(function(t)\{return new Date(t.lastDeployed||0).getTime()}))).lastDeployed')
{noformat}

This error occurs when the expression {{e.last(...)}} is executed on an empty array ({{{}t.environments{}}} is {{{}[]{}}}), returning {{{}undefined{}}}, and the subsequent attempt to access the {{.lastDeployed}} property throws the {{{}TypeError{}}}.

The attached user JSON response shows the exact data causing the issue for the project "R24-conditional-deploy":
{noformat}
 {{"deploymentProjects":[{"name":"conditional-deploy", ... "environments":[],"firstMainlineVersion":"develop-99", ... }]}}
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
The current known workaround is to *grant the affected users (or user groups) view access* to at least one environment within _all_ linked deployment projects in Bamboo. This ensures the {{environments}} array is never empty in the user's API response, bypassing the faulty frontend logic.

fields.summary: Deployment data fails to render for standard users in Jira (9.12.16+ on Java 17) due to a frontend JavaScript TypeError when a Bamboo API response returns an empty environments array for a project due to permission filtering.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The documentation link in the Advanced Settings is pointing to dead link 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to advanced settings

h3. Expected Results

Documentation link works 
h3. Actual Results

For example: 
{quote}A DC-only setting to define the maximum number of issues allowed in the Jira instance. To maintain an instance's performance, we recommend a value of 18M. Once the limit is set, Jira will start sending notifications when the limit is breached or close to being breached. For more information about the impact on those user accounts and recommended limits, see the Safeguards documentation: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/jadm-docs-0900/Configuring+Safeguards]
{quote}
The same link is used in other properties as well: 
 * jira.safeguards.issue.comments
 * jira.safeguards.config.restricted.groups
 * jira.safeguards.custom.fields
 * jira.safeguards.issue.types
 * jira.safeguards.issues
 * jira.safeguards.projects

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira itself, the notification is not sent to watchers without permission (Currently, watchers remains though permissions are removed).
Slack for Jira Data Center should follow it.
However, it seems that Slack for Jira Data Center send personal notifications for watchers without permission, when issues get updated.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install [Slack for Jira Data Center (official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/slack-for-jira-data-center-official]
 # Integrate Jira with Slack
 # Login Jira with an user and watch a issue.
 # Enable slack account and slack notification from profile
 # Login with an admin user and remove the above user from the permission of  'browse project' of the project.
 # To send notification, update the issue the watcher is watching 

h3. Expected Results

The personal notification(DM from bot) should not sent, since the user does not have permission.
h3. Actual Results

The personal notification(DM from bot) should not sent, since the user does not have permission.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h4. Issue Summary

While adding attachment via drag and drop on chrome version 142.0.7444.135, it doesn't add attachment and the screen keeps flickering.

The issue is not reproducible with Jira 10.3.8 and latest 10.3.x on the same chrome version.

This is reproducible on Data Center: yes
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new issue

 * Try adding attachment via drag and drop on chrome 142.0.7444.135

h3. Expected Results

The attachment should get added successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Attachment doesn't gets added and the screen keeps flickering. Kindly refer to the screen recording
 * [^Drag&Drop_attachment.mov]

h3. Workaround
 * Try adding attachment via browse functionality.

 * Use Firefox for adding attachment via drag and drop

fields.description:
When editing a multiline text field on a work item (e.g. description) using automations, it is not treated as markdown.

Examples:
 # "# Example Header" should be rendered as a heading, but is instead treated as a numbered list.
 # "[] checklist item" is not rendered as a checklist / action item, but is left as plain text.

 

This does not match expected behavior and does not seem to be documented anywhere.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Renaming the Application link doesn't immediately reflect in the database, occurring only after loading the issue page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* Set up two Jira Instances, referred to as Jira A and Jira B.
*2.* Create an Application Link:
In Jira A, establish a new application link to Jira B, naming it "JiraA to JiraB."
*3.* Add a Remote Link:
In Jira A, create an issue (e.g., Issue-1) and add a remote link to an issue in Jira B. Ensure you select "JiraA to JiraB" as the server when creating the link.
*4.* Verify the Application Name:
Run the following SQL query to check the applicationname in the remotelink table:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM remotelink;
{code}
Note that the applicationname column reflects "JiraA to JiraB."
*5.* Rename the Application Link:
Change the application link name in Jira A from "JiraA to JiraB" to "JiraC to JiraD."
*6.* Run the SQL query again:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM remotelink;
{code}
*7.* Observe that the applicationname still shows "JiraA to JiraB," indicating that it hasn't updated immediately.
*8.* Check Issue History:
Open Issue-1 in Jira A. You'll see that the history shows a remote link update under your username, with the update date set to the current date, which is incorrect.
*9.* Final Verification:
Reload the issue page in Jira A, then run the SQL query once more. The applicationname should now be updated to "JiraC to JiraD."
h3. Expected Results

The change is immediately reflected in the database
h3. Actual Results

The change only occurs when loading the issue page, resulting in a new entry being added to the issue history as if the change had occurred at the time of the issue page load.
h3. Workaround

To avoid incorrect history entries and update dates, you can directly update the applicationname in the database.

(!) Ensure you take a full database backup before proceeding!
(!) Test the following SQL update thoroughly in a lower environment before applying it to production:
{code:sql}
-- Update the applink name 'JiraC to JiraD' and 'JiraA to JiraB' accordingly
UPDATE remotelink SET applicationname = 'JiraC to JiraD' WHERE applicationname = 'JiraA to JiraB';
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Looking at the instruction from [Creating a custom Release Notes template containing release comments|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/creating-a-custom-release-notes-template-containing-release-comments/] page, it is observed that it is suggested that we should create a custom field under the “{*}Release notes comments{*}” name, but on the provided template of the modified “releasenotes-text.vm” file, you can see the following line: {{#if($customField.name.equals("release notes comments"))}} is a case-sensitive comparison.
h3. Suggested Solution
- Update the [Name|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/creating-a-custom-release-notes-template-containing-release-comments/#:~:text=Name%3A%20Release%20notes%20comments] of the custom field to "{{{}release notes comments" to {{}}}}match the one in the .vm template.
- Add the complete configuration of the custom release notes:
{quote}
** Create a backup of the \{{velocity-default.properties }}file
** Add the {{allowlist}} under template loaders:
{code:java}
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# T E M P L A T E  L O A D E R S
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
#
resource.loader.file.allowlist.enabled = true
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- {code}
** In the introspector.proper.allowlist.methodssection, add the following methods to the existing ones:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.DocumentIssueImpl#getIssueType(),\
com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.CachingCustomFieldManager#getCustomFieldObjects(java.lang.Long java.lang.String),\
com.atlassian.jira.config.properties.ApplicationPropertiesImpl#getString(java.lang.String),\
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField#getValue(com.atlassian.jira.issue.Issue),\
{code}
** Restart Jira
{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes when re-indexing a project, it appears that the re-indexing gets stuck at 100%. After waiting a long time (for a 10,000 issues project on a two nodes instance with a total of 300,000 issues it took 5 minutes to re-index and an additional 25 minutes to complete), the re-indexing completes successfully.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
#   Have both JSM and JSW installed. 
#  Use a data set with a couple of hundred thousands issues.
#  Create a new Scrum project
#  Import 10,000 issues into the project you just created (use CSV + import from external system).
#  Trigger a project re-index.

h3. Expected Results

Completes shortly after showing 100% progress and shows the "Acknowledge" button
h3. Actual Results

Does not show the "Acknowledge" button immediately and will continue to seem as though it's re-indexing the project. Eventually the "Acknowledge" button will be shown.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When migrating from Lucene to OpenSearch and starting a new node configured to use OpenSearch, the node will fail to start successfully i.e. it's /status endpoint will return a 500. This is due to the Index consistency check failing due to the default 10% fault tolerance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a new Jira node to use OpenSearch
 # Start the node in an existing cluster (i.e. one which has many projects and issues)

h3. Expected Results
The node starts up and can accept traffic

h3. Actual Results
The node returns a 500 on the /status endpoint, preventing it from starting up successfully.

The below INFO log entry is found in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
Index consistency check finished. indexConsistent: false; timeToCheckIndexConsistency:...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Set {{-Dcom.atlassian.jira.index.consistency.tolerance.percentage=100}} on the OpenSearch configured node and restart.

fields.summary: Index consistency check fails on an empty index when using OpenSearch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some Webhooks (JQL based) might not trigger correctly due OpenSearch's eventual consistency.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a webhook with a JQL for a specific issue e.g. IssueKey
 # Update the issue through the UI e.g. change the priority

h3. Expected Results
The webhook triggers

h3. Actual Results
The webhook does not trigger

h3. Workaround
Set the cluster to force refreshing on write for OpenSearch. This is achieved by setting {{-Dopensearch.force.refresh.on.write=true}} on every node in the Jira cluster (node must restarted for changes to take effect)

fields.description:
h4. Summary:

In Jira, users have the option to enroll in two-step verification for basic authentication by navigating to Profile > Two-Step verification, then completing the rest of the setup instructions.

If an organization needs to enforce this for all users on their site, they are forced to add a JVM argument then restart services for the changes to take affect
h4. Suggestion:

It would be nice for administrators to be able to manage their authentication policy from the Administration Settings in Jira.

In turn, no restart would be required for the policy changes to be applied to users on their next login.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Associating the Default workflow scheme causes a null pointer exception when the project's workflow scheme is called from the REST API in Jira version 10 and above
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate the Default workflow scheme to a project
!Screenshot 2025-10-30 at 2.24.38 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Call /rest/api/2/project/(projectID)/workflowscheme

h3. Expected Results

/rest/api/2/project/(projectID)/workflowscheme returns a value successfully
h3. Actual Results

/rest/api/2/project/(projectID)/workflowscheme returns an error message
 !Screenshot 2025-10-31 at 2.49.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
/rest/api/2/project/(projectID)/workflowscheme [c.a.p.r.v2.exception.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception 0cbc3013-7621-43d2-aa43-eff87c19fd21 thrown by REST service: Cannot invoke "java.lang.Long.longValue()" because the return value of "com.atlassian.jira.workflow.AssignableWorkflowScheme.getId()" is null
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "java.lang.Long.longValue()" because the return value of "com.atlassian.jira.workflow.AssignableWorkflowScheme.getId()" is null
        at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.workflowscheme.WorkflowSchemeBeanFactory.getUrlForParent(WorkflowSchemeBeanFactory.java:161)
        at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.workflowscheme.WorkflowSchemeBeanFactory.asBean(WorkflowSchemeBeanFactory.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.workflowscheme.ProjectWorkflowSchemeResource.getWorkflowSchemeForProject(ProjectWorkflowSchemeResource.java:106)
        at jdk.internal.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor15793.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:569)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Jira ships with another default workflow scheme called "classic" which you can use instead of Default
 * If the classic workflow scheme has been deleted you can create a new workflow scheme and associate all issue types to the default Jira workflow, re-creating the classic/default workflow scheme

*Notes*
This is not reproducible in Jira 9.12- even though the underlying database entires are null when using the Default workflow scheme:
{code}
jira912=# SELECT p.id AS project_id,                                                                                                                                                                                                  p.pkey AS project_key,                                                                                                                                                                                                                p.pname AS project_name,                                                                                                                                                                                                              ws.name AS workflow_scheme_name,                                                                                                                                                                                                      ws.id as workflow_scheme_id,                                                                                                                                                                                                          wse.workflow AS workflow_name,                                                                                                                                                                                                        w.id AS workflow_id                                                                                                                                                                                                                   FROM project p                                                                                                                                                                                                                        LEFT OUTER JOIN nodeassociation na ON na.source_node_id = p.id AND na.sink_node_entity = 'WorkflowScheme'                                                                                                                             LEFT OUTER JOIN workflowscheme ws ON ws.id = na.sink_node_id                                                                                                                                                                          LEFT OUTER JOIN workflowschemeentity wse ON wse.scheme = ws.id                                                                                                                                                                        LEFT OUTER JOIN jiraworkflows w ON wse.workflow = w.workflowname                                                                                                                                                                      where p.id = '12401'                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ORDER BY p.pkey;
 project_id | project_key | project_name | workflow_scheme_name | workflow_scheme_id | workflow_name | workflow_id 
------------+-------------+--------------+----------------------+--------------------+---------------+-------------
      12401 | BAS         | basic        |                      |                    |               |            
{code}

 the REST API returns the following:
{code}

fields.description:
UserPickerBrowser only shows up to 100 users when filtering by a group, even through the group has more than 100 users.

 
h3. Issue Summary

When opening the *UserPickerBrowser* window (for example, from _Watchers_ or any other screen that uses user filtering), filtering *only by group* displays a maximum of {*}100 users{*}, even if the group contains more. As a result, customers are unable to find users beyond that limit, since they never appear in the search results. This issue disrupts customer workflows, particularly when assigning watchers or performing similar user-selection tasks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group call *Group A*
 # Create more than 101 users to Jira
 # Add those users to *Group A*
 # Go to any issues -> Watchers
 # Click to Browser users.
 # Filter by *Group A*

h3. Expected Results

We expected to see all users in the search result
h3. Actual Results

We’re only able to see up to 100 users.

*Customer Impact*

This issue has a significant impact on customers with large user groups. Currently, there is no way to access or select users beyond the 100-user limit when filtering by group. This limitation blocks critical workflows such as assigning watchers, sharing issues, or selecting users for notifications—particularly in organisations with large teams or departments. As a result, customers are unable to complete essential tasks, leading to frustration and workflow delays.

It’s worth noting that in version 9, the particular customer that raised this issue used this feature extensively without experiencing performance issues, even with groups containing a large number of users.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Customers need the ability to access the Jira UI directly via https://ip:port (using the server’s IP address and port) even when Jira’s configured base URL uses a different hostname (e.g., FQDN with proxyName). This is currently blocked by strict XSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) checks and authentication logic introduced in Jira 10.2.x and later.
Their security policy requires all access to be over SSL (no plain HTTP), and customer cannot open additional non-SSL ports.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL search based on Select List (cascading) results in the error:
{code:java}
An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field 'xxxxx' does not exist.
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two projects, let's call them *Project A* and *Project B*
 # Create a customfield of type "Select List (cascading)", which we will name *CasField*
 # Add the customfield to the issue create and edit screen schemes.
 # Create two contexts for the customfield CasField: *Context A* and *Context B.*
 ** For Context A, add the options as shown in the screenshot below and assign it to Project A.
!Screenshot 2025-10-27 at 11.48.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
 ** For Context B: Add the options as shown in the screenshot below and assign it to Project B
{*}Note{*}, the cascadeOption *ABC* updated here is in uppercase, it was in lower case in Context A.
!Screenshot 2025-10-27 at 11.48.49 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a few issues in Project A and Project B by passing the custom field values.
 # The JQL below helps to filter the issues based on the cascadeOption.
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 # Navigate to {*}Settings> Projects{*}, delete Project B
 # Execute the same JQL

h3. Expected Results

The JQL filters the Jira issues based on the cascadeOption.
h3. Actual Results

The JQL fails with the following exception:
 
{code:java}
An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field 'CasField' does not exist.{code}
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Avoid using a mix of upper and lower case options in the context.
In the case described, updating context B to lowercase "abc" or context A to uppercase "ABC" helps resolve the issue.

Typically, LTS releases are supported for 2 years after the initial feature or LTS release, with security fixes provided throughout the entire 2-year support period.

 

This request is for a small extension of the security update program for 9.12.x to allow time for the transition to the new 10.3.x LTS version

Currently, Jira only has the option to enforce 2FA on either all admins or all users.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The Jira Rich Text Gadget (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:rte-text-gadget) fails to render or configure when embedded in Confluence.

When users attempt to add the gadget via the Jira Gadget macro in Confluence, the configuration dialog appears blank and no content can be added.

Other Jira gadgets (e.g., Assigned to Me, Filter Results, Pie Chart) work correctly in the same environment, indicating this issue is specific to the Rich Text gadget.

h3. Environment
* *Jira Data Center*: 9.12.x → 10.3.x
* *Confluence Data Center*: 7.19.x, 8.5.x, 9.2.7
* Gadget Host:
*- Bundled External Gadgets (7.19 / 8.5)
*- Gadgets for Confluence app 100.0.9 (Marketplace addon)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a valid application link between Jira and Confluence (*OAuth 1.0*).
# In Confluence, edit or create a page.
# Insert the Jira Gadget macro.
# From the macro list, select Rich Text Gadget (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:rte-text-gadget).
# Attempt to configure or insert the gadget onto the page.

h3. Expected Results
The Rich Text Gadget configuration UI should appear (editable text area).

User should be able to add content and successfully insert the gadget onto the Confluence page, similar to how it functions in a Jira dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
* The configuration window opens but remains blank (no editable field or buttons).
* The gadget cannot be configured.
 !Screenshot 2025-10-13 at 2.45.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
_No known workaround._

h3. Notes
* Confluence logs show that the gadget spec is retrieved successfully, but no configuration event occurs afterward.
* Other Jira gadgets (e.g., Assigned to Me) work as expected in the same environment.

fields.summary: Rich Text Gadget fails to render or configure when embedded in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be useful for users to view the Time Tracking fields in Issue View screen even if the field does not contain any value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create one issue without any value in the Time Tracking fields.
 # The fields do not show up in the Issue view.

h3. Workaround

While this cannot be achieved through any native functionality, you can make the Time Tracking fields ‘{_}*mandatory*{_}’ from the _*Field Configuration*_ option. That way the fields will have some value while the issue gets created and won’t get hidden.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per the [issue-level security configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver103/configuring-issue-level-security-1489807354.html] documentation, when setting the default security level for an issue security scheme, if the issue reporter does not have the ['Set Issue Security' permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-project-permissions-938847145.html], the issue will be set to the default security level. 

This does not seem to be working on Jira version 10.3.12, as it results in the exception below while creating the Jira issue.
*Security Level: The selected security level is not available for this issue. Please choose a different security level.*

*(on) Note:*  The issue has been observed since 10.3.12, and the change made between 10.3.11 and 10.3.12 is a fix for JRASERVER-74605.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project (project A)
 # Create an [issue security scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-issue-level-security-938847117.html]
 # Add two security levels to it and map it to the project by navigating to *Project settings > Issue security*  
 ## *Security Level 1*
 ## *Security Level 2*
 # Set Level 1 as the *Default* level.
 # Add a user (User A) to this project, having _Browse project_ and _Create issue_ permissions.
 # Add this user (User A) to {*}Security Level 2{*}, but not to Security Level 1
 # Make sure the “Security level”-System field is mapped to the Create issue screen mapped to the project.
 # Create an issue using User A from project A

h3. Expected Results

The user (User A) should be able to create a new issue from Project A successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Jiar issue creation fails with the following exception:

*Security Level: The selected security level is not available for this issue. Please choose a different security level.*

*!Screenshot 2025-10-22 at 12.56.52 PM.png|width=543,height=121!*
h3. Workaround
 * Mark the “Security level” system field as a *required field* to ensure the correct security level is selected during issue creation.
(+) Navigate to "{*}Project permission{*}" >"{*}Set Issue Securit{*}y" > Add the required groups/users.  

 * If the issue was created using the REST API, include the “Security level” field in the create section of the REST API script.

fields.summary: Jira issue creation fails due to a problem with security level mapping.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing issue types in the context configuration of custom fields, the issue types disappear if they are moved from the added to the available column.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Settings > Issues > Custom fields
 # Make sure you have at least one custom field added. If not, add a simple text field custom field with default settings.
 # For one of the custom fields, click on Actions > Configure context
 # Edit configuration > Move a few issue types to selected issue types
 # Save
 # Edit configuration > Move issue types back to available
 # Search for issue types in the available column

h3. Expected Results

All issue types matching the search query show up in the results
h3. Actual Results

Recently moved issue types are not visible.

When you remove the search query, the moved issue types are removed permanently from the UI
h3. Workaround

Save changes before searching

fields.description:
Please provide a version of the Jira calendar plugin that is compatible with the Jira 11 version of Data center. 
h3. Why This Is Important

There are customers who are heavily using the calendar plugin, and currently in Jira 11, it is incompatible and unusable due to the UPM signature check process which doesn't work for incompatible plugins.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Missing dark theme on the give feedback page.
!image-2025-10-20-16-18-41-096.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the user avatar in the top right corner
 # Theme > Dark
 # Again, click on the user avatar in the top right corner
 # Go to "Accessibility" 
 # Click the "Give feedback" button

Alternatively
 # Go to {{secure/AccessibilityPersonalSettings!default.jspa}}
 # Scroll down and click the "Give Feedback" button

h3. Expected Results

Dark-themed dialog
h3. Actual Results

White themed dialog
h3. Workaround

Use light theme
fields.customfield_21930: Not checked existing issues? Project not listed here? First read the instructions on the home page.
fields.summary: Giving a feedback in dark mode on AccessibilityPersonalSettings page lacks dark theme support

fields.description:
The Jira Docker image tags should include "-lts" for LTS releases.

We rely on an automated process that tracks new dependency versions and notifications, but it’s difficult to filter Docker tags specifically for LTS versions and their bugfixes.

Currently, the automation picks the latest tag, which doesn’t suit us, so we need to manually select specific versions each time.

Could there be an option to publish an additional tag with a clear qualifier indicating an LTS release?

For example, for Jira 10.3 LTS, the latest bugfix tag 10.3.12 is in Docker Hub. If it had a tag like ‘10.3.12-lts,’ our automation could easily filter for LTS versions.

Other software, such as Jenkins, already does this.
fields.customfield_21930: Not checked existing issues? Project not listed here? First read the instructions on the home page.
fields.summary: The Jira Docker image tags should include "-lts" for LTS releases.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition - Whenever using the CTRL+F search in the Backlog view, it displays duplicate results. !search1-2.png|thumbnail! !search1-2.png|thumbnail! - Inspecting the page HTML, we can see two entries: the actual issue and another one that seems related to assistive reading: {code:java} SCRUM-27 {code} {code:java}
SCRUM-27 ppp
{code} If we delete the '{{{}div class="assistive"{}}}' using the browser inspect, the search works as expected and returns only one result. h3. Suggested Solution - It would be good to have the ability to disable such functionality to avoid duplicate results.
